info.title: HomeAPI
info.description:
API to integrate your Liebherr consumer appliances into your Smart Home.

The HomeAPI provides basic endpoints to integrate your Liebherr consumer appliance into your Smart Home.
Before you are able to use the HomeAPI, you need to make sure the appliance is connected in the SmartDevice app and you have the API key at hand.

In the swagger UI, we use the following terms:
  - device = the Liebherr appliance
  - deviceId = the serial number of the appliance

For more information see: [documentation](https://developer.liebherr.com/apis/smartdevice-homeapi/)

get.summary: Get a specific device by the given device id
Get device controls by the given device id
Get device control by the given device id and control name. The optional zoneId query parameter may be used for filtering. This is particularly useful for temperature control.

TemperatureControlRequest.description: Model to set the temperature of a device

zoneId.description: The zone id of the device

target.description: The target temperature of the device

unit.description: The temperature unit of the device

ZoneToggleControlRequest.description: Model to set the zone control of a device

zoneId.description: The zone id of the device

value.description: The value of the toggle control

PresentationLightControlRequest.description: Model to set the presentation light

BaseToggleControlRequest.description: Model to set the base control of a device

value.description: The value of the toggle control

Device.description: A filtered representation of a device

currentMode.description: The current value of hydrobreeze: [OFF, LOW, MEDIUM, HIGH]

hasMaxIce.description: Whether the IceMaker on the appliance has a MaxIce feature

zoneId.description: position of the zone in the device as integer

zonePosition.description: position of the zone in the device. One of top, middle, bottom

value.description: The current device temperature, also known as display temp

target.description: The target temperature the user has set

min.description: The minimum value the user can set

max.description: The maximum value the user can set

unit.description: The temperature unit the user selected on the device

zoneId.description: position of the zone in the device as integer
